rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C89968

self.title: CDISC SEND Standardized Disposition Term Terminology

definition: Terminology related to the final disposition of the subject in a study.
name: Standardized Disposition Term
preferredTerm: CDISC SEND Standardized Disposition Term Terminology

terms.definition: An indication that the subject's death or sacrifice was due to a mishap or technical/operational error.
An indication that a subject was found in a deceased state. (NCI)
An indication that the study subject was sacrificed at a predetermined time before the end of the protocol-defined treatment or observation period.
An indication that the subject could not be found, in which case, its disposition was not known, and no postmortem data was available.
An indication that a subject was euthanized due to ethical reasons, such as being near death.
An indication that the subject did not receive treatment for a specific period of time following the end of the protocol-defined treatment or observation period before it was sacrificed.
An indication that the subject was alive when taken out of the study. (NCI)
An indication that the subject was sacrificed at the end of the protocol-defined treatment or observation period.
An indication that the subject was sacrificed before the end of the protocol-defined treatment or observation period, and the subject was not otherwise moribund.
